subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ち}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ち}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> May be cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-inline|길||road}}.

subSections.title: Suffix
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|じ}}

Contraction of the ''michi'' reading. <ref>{{cite-book|author=Frellesvig, Bjarke|title=A History of the Japanese Language|publisher=Cambridge University Press|location=Cambridge|year=2010|isbn=978-0-521-65320-6|page=43}}</ref>

subSections.title: Suffix
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|みち}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=みち|御|tr1=mi|pos1=honorific prefix|路|tr2=chi|t2=road, street, way}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The prefix ''mi'' was in reference to the {{m|ja|神|tr=kami||god or spirit}} of roads.

subSections.title: Noun
